intro: Alangium kenyense, commonly known as Kenyan alangium, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
